Subsection.Text: AFFIRMATIVE DEFENSE.All persons are presumed to be sane. It is an affirmative defense to a criminal prosecution that, at the time of the commission of the acts constituting the offense, the defendant was insane. Insanity is established when:

Paragraph.Text: The defendant had a mental infirmity, disease, or defect; and
Because of this condition, the defendant:

SubParagraph.Text: Did not know what he or she was doing or its consequences; or
Although the defendant knew what he or she was doing and its consequences, the defendant did not know that what he or she was doing was wrong.

Paragraph.Text: Mental infirmity, disease, or defect does not constitute a defense of insanity except as provided in this subsection.

Subsection.Text: BURDEN OF PROOF.The defendant has the burden of proving the defense of insanity by clear and convincing evidence.
